sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Governmental Joint Purchasing Act.

sections.heading: Definitions. For the purposes of this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. For the purposes of this Act:

sections.heading: Joint purchasing programs. Each chief procurement officer may establish a joint purchasing program and a cooperative purchasing program.
sections.text: Joint purchasing programs. Each chief procurement officer may establish a joint purchasing program and a cooperative purchasing program.

sections.heading: Conduct of competitive procurement. Under any agreement of governmental units that desire to make joint
sections.text:
purchases pursuant to subsection (a) of Section 2, one of the governmental units shall conduct the competitive procurement process.
Where the State of Illinois is a party to the joint purchase agreement, the
appropriate chief procurement officer shall conduct or authorize the competitive procurement process. Expenses of such competitive procurement process may be shared by the participating
governmental units in proportion to the amount of personal property,
supplies or services each unit purchases.

sections.heading: Bids, offers, and small purchases
sections.text: The purchases of all personal property, supplies and services under this Act, except for small purchases, shall be based on competitive solicitations unless, for purchases made pursuant to subsection (a) of Section 2 of this Act, it is the determination of the appl

sections.heading: Purchases made pursuant to this Act shall be made in
sections.text:
compliance with the "Local Government Prompt Payment Act", approved by the
Eighty-fourth General Assembly.

sections.heading: Any governmental unit may, without violating any bidding
sections.text:
requirement otherwise applicable to it, procure supplies
and services under any contract let by the State pursuant to lawful
procurement procedures. Purchases made by the State of Illinois must be approved or authorized by the appropriate chief procurement officer.

sections.heading: The provisions of this Act shall not apply to public utility
The powers and authority conferred by this Act shall be construed as in
sections.text:
addition and supplemental to powers or authority conferred by any other law
and nothing in this Act shall be construed as limiting any other powers or
authority of any public agency.
